Body:
In a project that is in fact a modified example of Iot win10 I succeed in reading values from ds1621 by sending 0xAA to read one value. That is repeated every second. The readings I receive vary from 1 to 16 degrees, within just 2 or 3 seconds. Most of the time the reading is 12 degrees. The actual room temperature where the device is installed is around 20 degrees Celcius and is stable (indoors).

What could possibly be the cause and the solution for this? I have connected to a Raspi2 for 3.5V (pin 1), ground (pin 6), SDA (pin 3) and SCL (pin 5). No further resistors or capacitors. The DS1621 is just the DIP8 case, no breakoutboard or anything.
Thanks for your reply Saurabh Kitani, that's a thought that has crossed my mind of course, but I am prepared to take my code in doubt... so still open to other suggestions! :-)
Can you post your code here, or on Github? Why are you sending 0xAA to read one value?

Hi Saurabh Kirtani, Excuses for having not replied earlier, we've had holidays here and next I was sick..:-(. The reason I have 0xAA is from the documentation: to read a single temperature value of 2 bytes. My code is posted here: https://onedrive.live.com/redir?resid=56CCD1B71E24988D!217306&authkey=!AH8iiKBpJDorUnA&ithint=file%2ccs
If you're getting values from the sensor, it would mean the connections are fine. The sensor may be faulty.
